messages.message: Let me know if you don't receive an invite shortly

Hey Guys. I'm about to give you all an invite to the staging environment. The link in the email will point to the live environment, so you will need to change the beginning of the link to be: https://kimono-dev.firebaseapp.com/
You should probably also bookmark the address for the staging environment: https://kimono-dev.firebaseapp.com/#/inbox
The backend of staging is https://api-staging.usekimono.com
Exactly, just those two I think

name and description shouldn't be empty or what?

good morning

great. do we have android release of app?

Lol go for it. Our main load issues are on the worker right now, but I'll tell you guys more about that during the standup on Monday

yesterday I wrote command in laravel for generation test conversation... Now I started writing the same command for generation test replies... I want to have stress test for the conversation with 10k replies
what will happen if we will load all of them to the viewport :smile:

what is not clear for me - perfomance... I know some real issues with an angularjs and a lot number of objects in HTML... angular scans DOM every time 2 times for the changes (2 way bindings)... It has some solutions, as I know, but we should keep in mind this potential botlneck
Yup, sounds like we agree on the same approach

I think, that we can adjust loading process and improve appendMessagesToConversation... 
we can update existing messages by it's ids
then, we will not clear loaded message
so, we don't need to clear .messages list of objects in the conversation when we load it
Correct

well, in general, yes, it have... +adding new message to conversation initiate loading process again
right/
?

That way, if you click on a conversation in the side bar again, it just appends the messages again (keyed by ID), which means it won't affect other loaded messages.
Make selse?
*sense

OK let me know if this will fix it... 1. conversation/list returns conversation objects but not message objects. 2. Clicking on a conversation loads messages (message list object) and appends to the conversation object, keyed by ID. 3. Loading more messages does the same as previous.

Ok just shows we need to change the way conversations are loaded. We should just load in the conversation object and append. Therefore it will only overwrite existing messages of you click on the sidebar, and leave any others loaded
Sorry, that was a terrible explanation

I prepend older messages to conversation
but when you click on the conversation in the left sidebar, we reload it again and loaded older messages disappear
it's possible to keep in memory, but question, if it has sence... and if we need it - then we need to fix that
brb
